description: During a visit from the Minister of Health (27th may 2020), the Governor of Timbuktu confirmed that the 130 million CFA Franc of government aid had been received and distributed according to a distribution key, namely 50 million for the regional health directorate and 80 million for the treatment centre. In-kind contributions have been received from partners engaged in the fight against Covid-19 in Timbuktu Region.On the issue of staff shortages, the Minister pointed out that soon the department's director of human resources will make doctors and nurses available to Timbuktu's health care. Equipment will also be reinforced and the head of the department promised to equip at least one of the northern regions with a mobile laboratory to detect the disease in time for treatment instead of referring each time to Bamako.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: April 10, 2020 "Malian President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita has announced a coronavirus aid package [worth some 500 billion CFA francs (USD 832 million)] for poor people and hard-hit firms, as cases continue to rise in the war-torn West African state. [...] the government would shoulder water and electricity bills for the poorest people in April and May, among other measures. [...] The government would also distribute 56,000 tonnes of grain in food aid and 16,000 tonnes of animal feed, he added, and allow tax rebates for firms hit hard by the virus.

description:
Since 7 July and for a period of two months, the Civil Affairs Division of MINUSMA has been implementing a "Citizen Mobilization for Zero Coronavirus in Mali" project, in collaboration with Junior Chamber International (JCI) and the Coalition of Alternative Debts of Mali (CAD-MALI). This project, which concerns Bamako and several regions of Mali, aims to support the fight against coronavirus by involving civil society actors.

Through its important communication component, nearly five million people will be indirectly reached by the awareness messages, thanks in particular to community radio stations, public notices in six languages, loudspeakers in public places, social networks and through the distribution of handwashing kits.

In addition to the six communes of the District of Bamako, activities have already taken place in Mopti, Bandiagara, Djenné, Ségou and Gao. They will continue until the end of August in Timbuktu, Kidal, Ménaka, Taoudéni, Douentza and Tessalit.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 30th, Mali announced reduced work hours to 7h30 to 2pm without any breaks, effective wednesday april 1st. This policy takes end on 1 August 2020:  Normal working hours shall be re-established throughout the national territory.The alternation of working days shall be discontinued. UPDATE: Normal working hours shall be re-established throughout the national territory of Mali with effect from 1 August 2020. The alternation of working days shall be discontinued.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 12th Mali suspends all important gatherings until further notice, such as festivals, concerts, conferences, etc. No specified cap in how many people can gather at once.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mali on March 17th, limits all gatherings to 50 people maximum in accordance with hygiene rules, and includes cultural and political events, weddings, funerals, sporting events, etc. All public gatherings are banned. UPDATE: Gatherings were limited to 50 and include now funerals, weddings, sporting events, cultural assemblies, and political events.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
